bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to William E. Deeks, March 29, 1924

div1.p: [Carter] writes that he hopes to be able to attend the conference in Kingston, Jamaica.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to William E. Deeks, March 29, 1924
div1.opener:
/LC
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
March 29, 1924.
Dr. W. E. Deeks, General Manager,
Medical Department, United Fruit Company,
17 Battery Place,
New York City, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Deeks:
div1.p: I am slowly improving, though really it is extremely slow.

I still hope to be able to attend the Conference at Kings-
ton, and if I can I certainly will.

I don't suppose any reservations have to made at this time,
do they?
With best wishes to you all, in which Laura joins, I remain
